author: gumb00
content: yes the struck-through part is overriden by the point below, so only legacy -> EOF delgatecall is allowed

author: gumb00
content: yes the new EXTCODE* behaviour is not in any EIP yet, but targeted for the same fork as EIP-3540, so that part of 3540 is outdated

author: purplehat.eth

author: purplehat.eth
content:
This is great to know! If that is the case that this is included in the same hard fork as EIP-3540 that will be great.

```
- If the target account of EXTCODECOPY is an EOF contract, then it will copy 0 bytes.
- If the target account of EXTCODEHASH is an EOF contract, then it will return 0x9dbf3648db8210552e9c4f75c6a1c3057c0ca432043bd648be15fe7be05646f5 (the hash of EF00, as if that would be the code).
- If the target account of EXTCODESIZE is an EOF contract, then it will return 2.
```

These are definitely really nice semantics to be able to rely on as all part of the same hardfork change ğŸ™ <a:ToadFastVibe:888836264818790521>
